summary: This document is an email chain from February 2021 between an FBI Special Agent, a Detective on an FBI task force, and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding investigative follow-ups in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The topics include checking for images of an individual, contacting Victoria's Secret and FedEx about document retention, and obtaining UK travel records for Maxwell and Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain discusses follow-up investigative actions related to Ghislaine Maxwell, including seeking UK travel records and reviewing images for photos of her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Maxwell as the subject for whom UK travel records are being sought.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email on February 17, 2021, requesting follow-up on several investigative items related to the Maxwell/Epstein case.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Responds on February 22, 2021, stating they haven't found images of the subject and will follow up on UK information.

persons.name: Detective MPH
persons.context: Responds on February 22, 2021, providing information about FedEx record retention and stating they are waiting for an answer from Victoria's Secret.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same investigation, with authorities seeking UK travel records for both individuals.
The AUSA is requesting investigative follow-ups from the FBI Special Agent.
The AUSA is requesting investigative follow-ups, and Detective MPH is providing updates on those requests.
Both are law enforcement officials copied on the same email chain discussing the investigation.

events.title: AUSA Requests Investigative Follow-ups
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email requesting follow-up on contacting Victoria's Secret and FedEx, reviewing images for photos of a subject, and obtaining UK travel records for Maxwell and Epstein.

events.title: Law Enforcement Responses to Follow-up Requests
events.description: An FBI Special Agent and a Detective on an FBI task force respond to the AUSA's requests, providing updates on the status of the inquiries.

keyFacts: Investigators were actively seeking UK travel records for both Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein as of February 2021.
Authorities were attempting to contact Victoria's Secret and FedEx to inquire about their document retention policies, likely seeking historical records.
Investigators were reviewing images in an attempt to locate photographs of a specific individual (likely Maxwell, based on context).
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI-led task forces well after Epstein's death.
FedEx was reported to retain records for only 1 to 5 years, which could limit the historical data available to investigators.
